wikipedia_page.main: Lionel Couch (1913–1989) was a British art director. He was nominated for two Academy Awards in the category Best Art Direction.

link_mentions.page: A Nightingale Sang in Berkeley Square (film)
response: It was shot at Twickenham Studios and on location around London. The film's sets were designed by the art director Lionel Couch.
**Sons and Lovers – Art Direction: Thomas N. Morahan; Set Decoration: Lionel Couch

Go for a Take is a 1972 British comedy film, directed by Harry Booth and featuring Dennis Price, Bob Todd, Reg Varney, Norman Rossington, Sue Lloyd and Anouska Hempel. Debbie Russ reprises her role as the character "Tiger" from the television series Here Come the Double Deckers (1970–71).GO FOR A TAKE Monthly Film Bulletin; London Vol. 40, Iss. 468, (Jan 1, 1973): 9. It was shot at Pinewood Studios with sets designed by the art director Lionel Couch. The film was released in the United States as Double Take.https://www.allmovie.com/movie/double-take-v89855

The film was shot at Pinewood Studios near London. It was filmed on location in Aguilas in Spain, which filled in for Havana. The film's  sets were designed by the art directors Lionel Couch and Enrique Alarcón.
